p.s: Two weeks after the end of the COP26 in Glasgow we can now judge if the COP26 was a failure or success.
We can also discuss about who had a positive impact on the outcome, who negative impacts on the outcome of COP26.
Clearly, Boris Johnson's speech was on these moments at COP26 where you could have asked yourself if everyone understood the dramatic issue around climate change.
AspeciallyEspecially against the background that Johnson was or still is someone who says that climate change is not proofen.
His speech may have touch upon important aspects, for example that it is now our generation to face climate change.
However his unadequateinadequate jokes didn make it all look silly.
Especially because no one laughed.
His reference to James Bond holding a bomb was, at least for me, not understandable.
All in all, his speech seem to be thrown together last minute before presenting.
Quite the contrary was the case with a speech of Sir David Attenborough, UK's most famous natural historian.
His speech seemed to be planned very well.
On his screen he showed stunning, cinematic pictures and quoted people expressing their deep fear regarding the climate change.
He did this to really bring his message of the need of COP26 to be a success across.
Sir David Attenborough has been seeing a lot of the world.
I could imagine that he with his 95 years of life experience could make a striking impression of the political leaders.
I could also imagine that this speech made an impression of the broader public, maybe some of them saw his spectacular films about nan and now also enjoyed his speech about climate crisis.
However, I personally think, that we cannot say that one particular speech has influenced the outcome of COP26.
This would be too easy.
196 governments can notcannot be influenced by one speech.
And we should also keep in mind that this conference was not necessarlynecessarily a success, although Barack Obama, former President of the United States might have called it one.
It would have been nice if for example the speeches of indigenous people had an impact of COP26 as they are the ones hit hardest by climate change, as Attenborough explained it.
But this was not the case.
